item.title: Phone launches in upcoming weeks: OnePlus 13, Samsung Galaxy S25 series, more to look forward - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Phone launches in upcoming weeks: OnePlus 13, Samsung Galaxy S25 series, more to look forward

Published on: Dec 19, 2024 by: Aishwarya Panda

The smartphone market is buzzing with upcoming launches including the OnePlus 13 series and Samsung Galaxy S25 series. As 2025 approaches, consumers can expect major announcements from these brands regarding their next-generation models.

Key Points

  • OnePlus 13 series: Launching on January 7, 2025, with Snapdragon 8 Elite and Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 processors.
  • Samsung Galaxy S25 series: Expected global debut on January 22, featuring three models powered by Snapdragon 8 Elite chip.
  • Asus ROG Phone 9: Launched globally but debuting in India in 2025, also featuring Snapdragon 8 Elite.
  • Xiaomi 15 series: Anticipated flagship series powered by Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset.

Conclusion

The upcoming weeks will see exciting launches in the smartphone market, providing great options for consumers looking to upgrade.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra price cut on Amazon—How to buy it with a ₹38,000 discount - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra price cut on Amazon—How to buy it with a ₹38,000 discount

Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

This article discusses the significant price drop of the Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra, which is now available for ₹91,010, offering a discount of ₹38,989 from its original launch price.

  • The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra's price has dropped to ₹95,800 on Amazon India.
  • With an Amazon ICICI credit card, the effective price can be brought down to ₹91,010 after cashback.
  • Samsung phones typically do not see significant price drops post-launch of a new flagship.
  • The S24 Ultra retains value well, likely maintaining a price of around ₹70,000 to ₹80,000 in the future.
“Samsung phones rarely drop in price after a new flagship is launched.”

In summary, the Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra is currently a great buy for anyone looking for a flagship phone at a significantly reduced price as it continues to provide value even with the upcoming S25 series launch.

item.title: iPhone 15 Plus gets a huge discount on Flipkart - India Today
item.description:
iPhone 15 Plus gets a huge discount on Flipkart

Publication Date: October 28, 2024 Source: India Today

Flipkart is offering the iPhone 15 Plus (128GB variant) at a discounted price of Rs 59,999, marking the lowest price of the year for the device.

  • The iPhone 15 Plus is originally priced at Rs 63,999.
  • Additonal bank offers on Flipkart Axis Credit card and various other banks are also available.
  • Features a 6.7-inch Super Retina XDR display with ProMotion technology (120Hz refresh rate).
  • Powered by the A16 Bionic chip for high performance.
  • Camera system includes a 48MP main sensor alongside Ultra Wide and Telephoto cameras.
  • Additional features include a long-lasting battery, USB-C port, and under-display fingerprint sensor.
  • Available in five colors: pink, yellow, green, blue, and black.
  • Rated IP68 for water and dust resistance.
  • The offer is notable, considering the device is not eligible for Apple Intelligence but still priced attractively.

item.description:
Three hotel stocks riding Santa’s wave: Is more cheer coming in 2025?

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Stock Market News

As Christmas approaches, Indian equities are caught between the festive cheer and market fluctuations. Despite a pullback, there may still be hidden opportunities in the market.

  • The Nifty50 index has fallen from a peak of 24,700 to below 24,000 amidst market fluctuations.
  • Analysts suggest that there might be stocks to watch as the festive season progresses.
  • The article discusses potential recovery patterns for certain sectors heading into 2025.
“But before you let your holiday cheer fade, a hidden gem in the market may be ready to surprise you.”

This article emphasizes that even in a volatile market, opportunities can still arise, particularly as the holiday season enhances consumer spending.

item.title: Vivo X200 series goes on its first sale today: Check India price, offers, specs and more - India Today
item.description:
Vivo X200 series goes on its first sale today: Check India price, offers, specs, and more

Published On: Dec 19, 2024 Source: India Today

Vivo's latest flagship series, the Vivo X200 and X200 Pro, are now available for purchase in India, featuring cutting-edge specifications and exciting offers.

Price, Offers and Availability

  • Vivo X200 starts at Rs 65,999 for 12GB + 256GB variant and Rs 71,999 for 16GB + 512GB variant.
  • Vivo X200 Pro priced at Rs 94,999 for 16GB + 512GB model.
  • Offers include easy EMI options, cashback with select banks, free 1-year extended warranty, and discounts on protection plans.

Specs and Features

The Vivo X200 features a 6.67-inch OLED LTPS quad-curved display, a 5,800mAh battery with 90W fast charging, and a triple rear camera setup with a 50MP main sensor. The Pro model has advanced imaging features with a 200MP sensor and supports 4K HDR video recording.

Published By: Unnati Gusain

item.title: Samsung Galaxy Unpacked On Jan. 22? Here’s What To Expect - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy Unpacked On Jan. 22? Here’s What To Expect

Date: 19 Dec 2024, Source: NDTV Profit Tech

Samsung is set to reveal the eagerly awaited Galaxy S25 series smartphones at its upcoming Galaxy Unpacked event in January 2025, likely on Jan. 22, as per leaks.

  • The Galaxy S25 series will feature Snapdragon 8 Elite chips and One UI 7 updates.
  • Expected models include Galaxy S25, S25 Plus, S25 Ultra, and a new Galaxy S25 Slim.
  • Galaxy S25 Ultra may have a new telephoto lens and enhanced camera features.
  • One UI 7 will introduce new AI features and design upgrades.
  • Preview of Samsung's mixed-reality headset, Project Moohan, anticipated at the event.
Samsung plans to showcase the Galaxy S25 series at the Galaxy Unpacked event, introducing advanced AI tools and camera upgrades.

The Galaxy Unpacked event is highly anticipated among tech enthusiasts as Samsung gears up to launch its latest flagship devices.

item.title: Nothing starts rolling out Nothing OS 3.0 update based on Android 15 in India - The Hindu
item.description:
Nothing OS 3.0 Update Based on Android 15 Begins Rolling Out in India

Publication Date: December 19, 2024
Source: The Hindu

On December 19, 2024, Nothing announced the rollout of Nothing OS 3.0 for its smartphones in India, based on Android 15. The rollout will occur in phases and will include several devices by early 2025.

  • The rollout targets Phone 2 and Phone 2a initially, with other devices to follow.
  • The update includes a new Photo Gallery app with advanced features.
  • Users can expect a fully customizable lock screen with shared widgets, a countdown widget, and an AI-powered smart drawer.
  • Improvements include enhanced pop-up views, quick settings, visual and performance upgrades, and updated typography.
“Nothing’s NOS 3.0 introduces new features and enhancements that elevate the user experience while paving the way for more customizable and shareable interactions.”

This update represents a significant enhancement for Nothing's device ecosystem, promising advanced features that focus on user customization and improved performance.

item.title: Feeling bored? Now chat with ChatGPT using landline phones, message on WhatsApp - The Week
item.description:
ChatGPT Now Accessible via Landline and WhatsApp

Publication Date: Thursday
Source: OpenAI

OpenAI has introduced new ways for users to interact with ChatGPT, enabling phone calls from landline phones for U.S. users and WhatsApp messaging for users globally.

  • Users in the U.S. can call ChatGPT at 1-800-CHATGPT (1-800-242-8478) for queries.
  • WhatsApp users can start chatting by adding the same number to their contacts.
  • 15 minutes of free usage per month is provided for landline calls.
  • WhatsApp chat currently supports only text messages with limited features.
  • Users must use the web or app for voice commands and advanced features.
“We provide a notice as you approach the limit and inform you when the limit has been reached,” said OpenAI regarding WhatsApp usage limits.

This new accessibility is part of OpenAI's initiative to broaden the reach of ChatGPT.

item.title: Apple hits out at Meta's numerous interoperability requests - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Apple Criticizes Meta's Interoperability Demands

Published: 19 December 2024, 03:53 IST

Apple has pushed back against Meta's multiple requests for access to its software tools, citing concerns over user privacy and security amid the ongoing rivalry between the two tech giants.

  • Apple claims that Meta's requests, which number 15, could compromise the privacy of users by allowing Meta extensive access to private data.
  • The requests are made under the EU's Digital Markets Act, which mandates Apple to ensure interoperability with rival developers.
  • Meta's request could enable it to access sensitive user information across various applications, according to Apple.
  • Apple highlighted Meta's history of privacy fines in Europe as a reason for its concerns.
  • The European Commission is set to provide guidance on the interoperability requirements by March next year, impacting Apple's compliance strategies.
“If Apple were to have to grant all of these requests, Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp could enable Meta to read on a user's device all of their messages and emails...” - Apple spokesperson

The ongoing discourse reflects broader tensions in the tech industry regarding privacy, competition, and regulatory measures that govern the interaction between large technology companies.

item.title: Apple hits out at Meta’s numerous interoperability requests - The Hindu
item.description:
Apple hits out at Meta’s numerous interoperability requests

Published on: December 19, 2024

Source: The Hindu

Apple has expressed strong concerns about Meta's numerous interoperability requests, citing potential risks to users' privacy and security. This critique emphasizes the ongoing rivalry between the two tech companies.

  • Apple claims that Meta's 15 interoperability requests could alter functionality affecting user privacy.
  • The European Union's Digital Markets Act mandates Apple to allow interoperability with rivals.
  • Meta aims to access Apple's technology to enhance its own devices like Meta Quest virtual reality headset.
  • Apple warns that granting access may allow Meta to track user activities extensively.
  • The European Commission is evaluating compliance with interoperability measures.
"If Apple were to have to grant all of these requests, Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp could enable Meta to read on a user's device all of their messages and emails," Apple stated.

As the EU prepares to enforce the interoperability provisions, this conflict highlights the ongoing competition and differing views on privacy between Apple and Meta.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra vs OnePlus 13: Price In India, Launch Date, Camera Upgrades, Specifications, Everythi - Times Now
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra vs OnePlus 13

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

Samsung and OnePlus are set to clash in 2025 with their flagship smartphones: the Galaxy S25 Ultra and the OnePlus 13. Here’s a detailed comparison of their features and launch dates.

  • Launch Dates: OnePlus 13 launches on January 7, 2025, while the Galaxy S25 Ultra is expected at a Galaxy Unpacked event on January 22, 2025.
  • Specifications: Both will feature Snapdragon 8 Elite chipsets; Galaxy S25 Ultra has a 6.9-inch display (QHD+), while OnePlus 13 has a 6.82-inch AMOLED display (2K+).
  • Battery: Galaxy S25 Ultra may have a 5,000mAh battery, while OnePlus 13 boasts a 6,000mAh battery.
  • Camera Upgrades: Galaxy S25 Ultra keeps a 200MP main camera; OnePlus 13 features a triple camera setup with three 50MP sensors.
  • Price: Galaxy S25 Ultra is expected around Rs 1,29,999, OnePlus 13 expected above Rs 64,999.
